articles.title: DGCA suspends Air India flight safety chief for a month | Mint - Mint
articles.description: The regulator has found deficiencies in the accident prevention work carried out by the airline and it also did not have requisite number of technical staff as required under the flight safety manual and the relevant civil aviation requirements.
articles.content: The Indian civil aviation regulator has suspended the chief of flight safety at Air India for a month after it discovered several deficiencies in a recent audit of the Tata Group-run airline. The Dir… [+2540 chars]
